lead_paragraph: The state’s Board of Regents voted to reduce the number of exams that some students with disabilities must pass to graduate high school.

headline.print_headline: Fewer Exams Required for Disabled Students
headline.main: Fewer Hurdles to Graduation for Disabled Students in New York

snippet: The state’s Board of Regents voted to reduce the number of exams that some students with disabilities must pass to graduate high school.
abstract: New York State Board of Regents approves new regulation that would allow students with disabilities who fail certain required Regents examinations to still graduate from high school as long as they pass English and math exams.
